data.title: William F. Grose
data.text:
William “Bill” Frederick Grose, 88, of Williamstown, W.Va., passed away Wednesday, June 8, 2016 , in Huntsville, Ala., after a long illness.

He was born April 29, 1928, in Auburn, W.Va., son of the late Clarence and Tensy Ward Grose.

He was a graduate of Harrisville High School Class of 1947. He was a member of First Baptist Church of St. Marys where he served as a deacon and trustee. He was a former member of the Belmont Lions Club, as well as, Mount Olivet Masonic Lodge and Scottish Rite of Parkersburg, W.Va. He served as a Private in the U.S. Army during the Korean War. Bill retired as a maintenance man from Quaker State Oil Refinery in St. Marys, W.Va., where he worked for 35 years with his brother Richard (Dick). After retirement, he worked for Pleasantsville Apartments and Edgeview Apartments for 16 years. In his spare time, he could be found in his woodworking shop making furniture and items for which he was well known.

Bill is survived by his wife of 63 years, Margaret Jean (Cornell) Grose; daughters, Jenice (Roque) Haines of Somerville, Ala., and Mary Ellen (Terry) Wise of Orchard Beach, Md.; brother, Harry (Genelea) Grose of Weston, W.Va.; four grandchildren, Jennifer Haines, Tiffany Wise, Amanda (Nathan) McAllister and Joshua Wise; three great grandchildren, Michael Hrachovy, Madison McAllister and Grayson McAllister; and many nieces and nephews.

In addition to his parents, Bill was preceded in death by brothers, Russell, Emery, Richard (Dick), Roy and David Grose; and sisters, Edra Grose, Wanda Underwood and Oleta Beckett.

Funeral viewings will be held at Ingram Funeral Home on Friday, June 17, 2016, from 3-5 p.m. and 7-9 p.m. Funeral service will be 11 a.m. Saturday, June 18, 2016, at the funeral home with the Rev. David Sommerville officiating. Burial will follow the funeral service at Pleasants Memorial Estates.

Ingram Funeral Home, 512 Second St., St. Marys, WV 26170
